channel.title: 华尔街日报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Myanmar’s Aung San Suu Kyi is sentenced to four years in prison https://t.co/HLS0nhtyK0

Breaking: New York City will require all private-sector workers to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19, Mayor Bill de Blasio said. The new mandate will go into effect Dec. 27. https://t.co/4vGlgF5kJa
How Elon Musk became a high-profile cheerleader of China's Communist Party https://t.co/IhbzquXPZi
Russia and India set to reinforce defense ties at a summit meeting, as the U.S. considers sanctions over New Delhi’s purchase of a Russian missile system https://t.co/KmoBtLlCGO

High inflation has been blamed on supply-chain bottlenecks, labor shortages and the effects of fiscal stimulus, but there’s another factor at work—a shift away from globalization https://t.co/ahBtzvLOC1
Myanmar’s Aung San Suu Kyi was found guilty and sentenced to four years in prison in the first verdicts in a raft of charges brought by the military https://t.co/pzaz55oIxU
China wants to put its first Atlantic military base in Equatorial Guinea, U.S. intelligence shows. The prospect has set off alarm bells in Washington. https://t.co/hO08mBbRsY
Netflix announced its 2022 lineup, which includes new seasons of “Stranger Things” and “The Umbrella Academy” https://t.co/ydMlvGWmTl

“I am very lucky in my life that I have benefited from second chances, and I am aware that other people don’t even get first chances.” Ben Affleck talks Jennifer Lopez, fame, infamy, addiction and finally getting satisfaction—or as close to it as he’ll get https://t.co/R570DXyLPI
A New England Patriots linebacker and his wife turn NFL trades into investment opportunities #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/bJXp6pWh35 https://t.co/cEHTEY2WCe

An explosion shook the area near Iran’s main nuclear-enrichment plant late on Saturday, prompting conflicting explanations from Iranian officials as Tehran engages in talks with world powers over its nuclear program https://t.co/zlUZc0dSlv

New surveys from the U.S. Labor Department show exactly who is quitting—or thinking about quitting—as part of The Great Resignation: low-wage workers, employees of color and women not in management https://t.co/QqksO8dwkW
U.S. workers handed in nearly 20 million resignations this spring and summer. "Everybody quitting is saying, 'I became part of the Great Resignation.' " https://t.co/9UqslINCYp
Bob Dole, a fixture on the Washington scene for more than half a century and a national leader of the Republican Party, died at 98 https://t.co/XlYeOqZzSJ

Some alumni groups, driven by politically moderate or conservative baby boomers, say college campuses have been overtaken by progressive groupthink—and they’re not sending any more checks until something is done about it https://t.co/9ZfWH9vT3w

From @WSJopinion: The Biden administration at some point will realize that its political fortunes are tied to a virus that isn’t going anywhere, writes @KimStrassel. The longer it takes to make a clean break, the likelier it is to succumb to Covid. https://t.co/VdVRAGj8Mt
China wants to put its first Atlantic military base in Equatorial Guinea, U.S. intelligence shows. The prospect has set off alarm bells in Washington. https://t.co/y8qR9xehlO
At least 13 people were killed after the eruption of Mount Semeru, on the Indonesian island of Java https://t.co/SzI4msp9U4
Evidence is building that immunity from Covid-19 infection is at least as strong as that from vaccination. Scientists are divided on the implications for vaccine policy. https://t.co/GfdwboB3Mz

High inflation has been blamed on supply-chain bottlenecks, labor shortages and the effects of fiscal stimulus, but there’s another factor at work—a shift away from globalization https://t.co/IL4tbDvjKd
Breaking: Bob Dole, a fixture on the Washington scene for more than half a century and a national leader of the Republican Party, has died at 98 https://t.co/KXn0M5a3gX

A small study found a pattern of milder illness from the Omicron variant than in previous waves of Covid-19. The authors cautioned that it is too early to say for sure if the new strain is less virulent than its predecessors. https://t.co/eQoR2WDawX
Containment was a winning strategy for the Cold War. It can also guide the U.S. in the long contest ahead with China, writes historian Hal Brands. https://t.co/OQwTPp85ZC
Hundreds of thousands of Americans are striking out on their own as consultants, retailers and small-business owners https://t.co/BhOFO3VWn1

Jeffrey Epstein's former pilot testified that Ghislaine Maxwell was intricately involved in the disgraced financier's daily life, managing household staff and flying with him on a private plane that flew former presidents and celebrities https://t.co/llztcnhRhy

From @WSJopinion: We need a new, stronger model of public education that is based on evidence, centered on children, and built around achievement, excellence and accountability for all, writes @MikeBloomberg https://t.co/LRT94q1JYP

Some alumni groups, driven by politically moderate or conservative baby boomers, say college campuses have been overtaken by progressive groupthink—and they’re not sending any more checks until something is done about it https://t.co/n1goAMRqEu
Tesla came to China with big plans. China had even bigger plans for Tesla. https://t.co/Ql7pbZRfIv
The currency is collapsing, protestors are on the streets, and people are lining up for subsidized bread. Inside Turkey's economic turmoil. https://t.co/CsvPdZs5cA

An explosion shook the area near Iran’s main nuclear-enrichment plant Saturday, prompting conflicting explanations from Iranian officials as Tehran engages in talks over its nuclear program https://t.co/daC3Y8XrfN
Eighty years ago, Japanese submariner Kazuo Sakamaki took part in the surprise attack on Pearl Harbor—and became his country’s first prisoner of war. https://t.co/VUyo5uSJ95
The United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia are reopening diplomatic missions and restarting flights as they try to match Qatar’s sway in Taliban-ruled Afghanistan https://t.co/6NCptXOLFW

Home buyers in high-cost areas of the U.S. will be able to borrow nearly $1 million for a mortgage loan backed by the government, a reflection of the rapid appreciation in home prices nationally https://t.co/p1NbM9KGMc

“I am very lucky in my life that I have benefited from second chances, and I am aware that other people don’t even get first chances.” Ben Affleck talks Jennifer Lopez, fame, infamy, addiction and finally getting satisfaction—or as close to it as he’ll get https://t.co/1atjGnWGuQ
Adele said she will perform at a four-month long residency in Las Vegas early next year https://t.co/MmKm07OiUx
From @WSJopinion: Lockdowns don't stop the virus, and vaccine mandates are hurting hospitals. The Omicron variant is no excuse for more of either one. https://t.co/BfiC0cEOGY
Tesla came to China with big plans. China had even bigger plans for Tesla. https://t.co/U1abEcEKKE
Apple’s vision for life after the iPhone is coming into view, writes @mims https://t.co/WLDWQuDiPM
CNN anchor Michael Smerconish will temporarily fill in for Chris Cuomo next week, the cable network said https://t.co/DBkTBAiDbX

From @WSJopinion: The Biden administration at some point will realize that its political fortunes are tied to a virus that isn’t going anywhere, writes @KimStrassel. The longer it takes to make a clean break, the likelier it is to succumb to Covid. https://t.co/cTglXdmoip
CNN fired Chris Cuomo for his role in the sexual-harassment scandal that led to the resignation of his brother, former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo https://t.co/30R4zHktSz

A woman using the pseudonym Jane testified in federal court that Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell gave her money, bought her gifts including underwear and repeatedly sexually abused her beginning when she was 14 https://t.co/S8qFyvVNvf

Some alumni groups, driven by politically moderate or conservative baby boomers, say college campuses have been overtaken by progressive groupthink—and they’re not sending any more checks until something is done about it https://t.co/6f8Inrppzf

A total solar eclipse is happening Saturday. But only a few thousand people—and penguins—will see it in-person. Here's how to watch it if you can't cruise around the South Orkney Islands. https://t.co/oP2VGiBzxX
The Omicron variant may lead to more infections but vaccinated people will likely remain protected from severe disease, vaccine maker BioNTech's founder said https://t.co/SNFjz8o13E

French President Emmanuel Macron traveled to Saudi Arabia to meet Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, who since the 2018 murder of Jamal Khashoggi hasn’t visited the U.S. or Europe and has been largely shunned by Western leaders https://t.co/IGIrVvc6tX

The Women’s Tennis Association said that its largest Chinese sponsor iQiyi, a Netflix-like streaming platform, asked to be removed from the WTA’s website as the organization spoke out about Peng Shuai https://t.co/nGJqwQBQtX
Biden will require travelers to the U.S. to provide a negative Covid test within a day of departure and will extend transit mask rules to slow Omicron's spread https://t.co/N3y7HOZTHH
The parents of the Michigan high-school shooting suspect were found and arrested, police said, hours after they were charged with involuntary manslaughter https://t.co/s60atCpSVV
Evidence is building that immunity from Covid-19 infection is at least as strong as that from vaccination. Scientists are divided on the implications for vaccine policy. https://t.co/ceZEPLmcwD
